messages: 982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:16): the fa0 is leading to the 24 port dlink switch
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:16): and the box you're using is connected also to that dlink?
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:24): i bet the statemachine on the linux box is hosed. lots of fucking with the routing table will do that. Any objections to booting it?
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:24): I just installed an os on that machine
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:25): so yeah, go ahead and reboot it. we'll double-check the routing table isn't wack
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:30): that way it resets default policies and whatnot
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:31): ok, wr mem on the cisco, and reload it? any objections?
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:32): but i'll give it a try
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:35): so, you're behind the cisco, too?
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:35): all the windows boxes work fine
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:36): well i haven't messed w/ the other linux box
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:39): ok, on the linux box, ethtool eth0, and sh int fa1 on the router.
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:41): ok, speed and duplex match (but you're able to shell to it, so that's not surprising)
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:41): can you ping your windows box from the linux box and vice versa?
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:46): only after i tried to ssh to it
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:46): before i ddi that I wasn't able to ping the winbox
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:46): now it's a two way street
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:47): that linux machine has an issue with arp
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:47): when you installed linux, did you disable selinux?
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:47): 'cause that could be fucking with you.
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:48): where's the file for that again?
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:48): hm, i usually turn it off 'cause i don't want or need it
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:48): but at warn it shouldn't actually be doing anything
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:51): 00:0b.0 Ethernet controller: Standard Microsystems Corp [SMC] 83c170 EPIC/100 Fast Ethernet Adapter (rev 06)
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:54): okay, fedora 4 -- that kernel has a few bugs but nothing like that i remember
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:54): fwiw, fedora 5 was released a couple months ago
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:55): arp -a and sh arp again, right after trying to ping
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (12:57): try pinging from both ends at the same time
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:59): Sending 5, 100-byte ICMP Echos to 10.10.10.73, timeout is 2 seconds:
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (12:59): Success rate is 100 percent (5/5), round-trip min/avg/max = 1/1/4 ms
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:00): 10.10.10.73 is the windows box I thought
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:00): i've been up way too long
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:00): I didn't sleep at all on monday
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:00): i've been up since 11 am sunday
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:01): haha, i wish i could still do that
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:02): i max out at about 24 hours now.
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:02): well I couldn't have done it on will alone
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:03): I need to be somewhere at 8 pm
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:03): which means I need at least 12 hrs of sleep
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:03): I need to get this done in two hours or less
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:05): ok, one last thing -- let's look at sh run on the router and ifconfig -a on the linux box
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:05): if that doesn't work, i'd try slapping a different ethernet board (if you have one) into that linux box
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:05): well, if it doesn't show anything obvious, anyways
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:09): rip might be jacking with it
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:09): you might want to disable rip
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:10): i can't keep my eyes open any longer 8 /
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:10): yeah, unless you're actually using routed for something, i'd shut rip off
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:11): in small, classless networks it's better to have a couple static routes than dynamic ones
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:11): i will, but i'll be at work so i can't put 100% to it
482e88a50abece27e1db5d6ead96d259 (13:12): likewise, i'm about to faceplant into the keyboard
982580016a6e8302413d88dc952ea632 (13:12): that's what i was gonna do
